page.title: 08Farming in Soulbury
page.content: Farms around Soulbury range from 700 acres to 70 acres.They are intensively farmed being mostly of Grade 3 heavy clay soil, although there are pockets of sand in the area. Because the soil warms up late in the spring, mainly winter crops are grown. These consist of barley, wheat, oats and rape (an oil seed crop). The planting of rape, so conspicous because of the glowing yellow of the flowers in spring, has increased because the subsidies from the E.E.C. make it such a highly profitable crop. Because of the vast stocks of wheat and barley in Intervention, local farmers are looking for alternative scources of income. Field beans are occasionally grown but have not done well this year; lupins and borage are a future possibility as an oil crop but are still in their infancy.
